meanings.definition: To exert pressure or force on something.
meanings.sent1: She preesed the door to open it.
meanings.sent2: He preesed the ball to make it bounce higher.
meanings.sent3: The cat preesed against the window to get a better view.
meanings.sent4: The wind preesed against the sails, propelling the boat forward.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the books preesed down on the shelf, causing it to bend.

meanings.sent1: Mom preesed the toothpaste tube to get the last bit out.
meanings.sent2: He preesed the clay between his fingers to shape it into a figure.
meanings.sent3: The chef preesed the dough gently to form perfect cookies.
meanings.sent4: The hiker's backpack preesed uncomfortably against his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The child preesed the playdough into different shapes with delight.

meanings.definition: To push or move something forward.
meanings.sent1: She preesed the swing to make it go higher.
meanings.sent2: The worker preesed the cart along the warehouse aisle.
meanings.sent3: The students preesed their desks closer to the front of the class.
meanings.sent4: The river preesed the debris downstream after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The car preesed through the thick fog, slowly making its way forward.

meanings.definition: To urge or encourage someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach preesed the team to give their best effort.
meanings.sent2: She preesed her friend to join her on the adventure.
meanings.sent3: The teacher preesed the students to complete their assignments on time.
meanings.sent4: The parents preesed their child to study hard for the exam.
meanings.sent5: The mentor preesed the mentee to pursue their dreams with determination.
